Project.Brief history of your project and organi:
NASA MODIS North America Land Surface Temperature Dataset (2000-2024) Overview
This dataset is derived from NASA's MODIS (Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer) satellite sensor, providing daily land surface temperature observations for North America (30째N-60째N, 125째W-65째W) from 2000 to present, with a 1km spatial resolution. It is widely used for climate research, agricultural monitoring, and disaster early warning systems.

Key Features
Data Source: NASA Terra/Aqua satellites (MODIS official page)

Temporal Coverage: 2000 to present (daily updates)

Geographic Coverage: North America (USA, Canada, and parts of Mexico)

Data Format: HDF/EOS (scientific standard format)

Variables: Land Surface Temperature (LST), quality control flags, etc.

Total Size: ~900TB (daytime data only)
Project.Describe the data being stored onto File:
Content to be Stored Will Include:
1. Raw HDF Files

Daily temperature data files officially provided by MODIS (e.g., MOD11A1.006 product)

Example filename: MOD11A1.A2024001.h08v04.006.2024003050241.hdf

2. Preprocessed Index Files

Spatiotemporal indexes (CSV/JSON format) for efficient retrieval

Metadata (including acquisition time, orbit number, data quality score)

3. Visualization Support Data (Optional)

Annual/monthly temperature averages in GeoTIFF format

Thumbnails (PNG) for quick preview
